title: Define Project Requirements
description: Gather and document user stories, functional requirements, non-functional requirements, and constraints for the ImmutableVersionControlSystem. This includes performance, scalability, security, usability considerations, as well as potential use cases and edge cases that should be addressed in the system's design. The gathered information will serve as a foundation for the development of the system.

title: Design Immutable Data Structures
description: Design and document the immutable data structures that will be used in the version control system.

title: Develop Backend Components
description: Implement the backend components according to the designed architecture and data structures.

title: Develop Frontend Components
description: Implement the frontend components that provide a user-friendly interface for interacting with the version control system.

title: Implement Version Control Logic
description: Develop the core logic for managing and tracking code history using immutable data structures.

title: Set Up Database Schema
description: Design and implement the database schema for storing version control data.

title: Test the Version Control System
description: Perform unit tests, integration tests, and system tests on the version control system to ensure correct functionality.

title: Deploy and Integrate the System
description: Deploy the version control system to a staging environment, test in production-like conditions, and make any necessary adjustments before full deployment.

title: Security Review and Audit
description: Review and audit the system for potential security vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with industry best practices.

title: Documentation Development
description: Create user manuals, API documentation, and other necessary technical documentation for the version control system.
